column4: I don't know how, but "Mute" is just NOT working. The system detects that I press the key, but it's not doing anything.
Somebody please advise.
does the volume icon change when you press the button?
Nope.
are you on a laptop? what kind?
Nope, on my PC. Though Mute stopped working on my laptop quite some time ago. PC is an HP Pavilion a6512p running Jaunty.
sorry .. i was just interested in your problem.. didn't actually know how to fix it.. althought it might be that the kernel doesn't support the hardware (extra buttons your computer has)
It was working earlier.
And it doesn't work even if I set the shortcut to something like Alt+M.
are you using the right sound mixer? accidentally switched by any chance?
How do I check?

you can go to the sound preferences and there are various things you can test.. and also test the volume slider controls.. because that's what your keyboard is controlling right? is it controlling MASTER?
I can right-click the Volume icon in the panel and hit Preferences... it is indeed set to Master.
I also can't think of anything I've done today that would change anything regarding my volume.
okay.. does the volume slider work to change your volume?
Yup. And the Volume Up/Down keys on my keyboard work. Just not Mute.
that's so strange.. all the keyboard commands should be controlling the same thing.. i'm assuming you set with the "keyboard shortcuts" in preferences?
have you tried logging out and back in?
Yes, I did. The default is the Mute key and I even tried changing the shortcut. Doesn't work. No, I haven't tried logging out.
give it a shot.. let's see what happens when GNOME reloads
K, brb.
Still doesn't work.
sorry dude, i don't know what the problem is.. since everything else seems to work fine
Thanks anyway for trying; I'm going to register on the forums and post my question there.
